Package tage.networking.server

Class TCPServerSocket

java.lang.Object
java.net.ServerSocket
tage.networking.server.TCPServerSocket
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, IServerSocket
public class TCPServerSocket extends ServerSocket implements IServerSocket
A TCP implementation of a IServerSocket. This socket is able to send and receive Serializable objects from server side of a game. An underlying ServerSocket is used in this implementation.
Author:
Kyle Matz Modified from the SAGE Networking package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz. Ported to TAGE by Scott Gordon.

  • Constructor Details

    • TCPServerSocket

      public TCPServerSocket(int localPort, GameConnectionServer server) throws IOException
      Creates a TCPServerSocket bound to the local port. The server passed in is used to process the packets received by this socket. See ServerSocket(int) for information on local binding.
      Parameters:
      localPort - local port to bind to
      server - server to process packets
      Throws:
      IOException

  • Method Details

      public Socket accept() throws IOException
      Overrides accept to use the ServerSocket.implAccept(Socket) instead which is used to create a TCPClientSocket.

      Throws:
